thread.title: Expert Picks: Waste Management Phoenix Open
thread.title_full: Expert Picks: Waste Management Phoenix Open

author: Staff
title: Expert Picks: Waste Management Phoenix Open
text:
Expert Picks: Waste Management   Staff   @PGATOUR Hideki Matsuyama will defend his title this week at TPC Scottsdale. (Sam Greenwood/Getty Images) 
How it works: Each week, our experts from PGATOUR.COM will make their selections in PGA TOUR Fantasy Golf driven by AVIS. Each lineup consists of four starters and two bench players that can be rotated after each round. The first fantasy golf game to utilize live ShotLink data, PGA TOUR Fantasy Golf driven by AVIS allows you to see scores update live during competition. To learn more or sign up click here . 
EXPERT PICKS: WASTE MANAGEMENT PHOENIX OPEN 
EXPERT 
EXPERT PICKS: WASTE MANAGEMENT PHOENIX OPEN 
SEAN MARTIN 
His year is off to a strong start since his two surgeries. He’s rounding into form as he approaches TPC Scottsdale. 
EXPERT 
PROJECTED WINNER 
Phil Mickelson 
His year is off to a strong start since his two surgeries. He’s rounding into form as he approaches TPC Scottsdale. 
JONATHAN WALL 
Winning back-to-back on TOUR is tough. Three times is almost unheard-of. I think JT makes it happen in Phoenix. 
EXPERT 
PROJECTED WINNER 
Justin Thomas 
Winning back-to-back on TOUR is tough. Three times is almost unheard-of. I think JT makes it happen in Phoenix. 
BEN EVERILL 
The defending champion is just too hard to ignore as a potential winner. He was grinding hard in practice last week - and he's ready to finally beat Thomas. 
EXPERT 
PROJECTED WINNER 
Hideki Matsuyama 
The defending champion is just too hard to ignore as a potential winner. He was grinding hard in practice last week - and he's ready to finally beat Thomas. 
MIKE MCALLISTER 
Tough to pick against Thomas, who’s won 3 of his last 5 starts, but expect the defending champ to rebound from a couple of so-so finishes. 
EXPERT 
PROJECTED WINNER 
Hideki Matsuyama 
Tough to pick against Thomas, who’s won 3 of his last 5 starts, but expect the defending champ to rebound from a couple of so-so finishes. 
MATT COCHRAN 
T4, T20, T9 in his last three starts on TOUR. Finding his stride after a solid week at Torrey Pines. 
EXPERT 
PROJECTED WINNER 
Tony Finau 
T4, T20, T9 in his last three starts on TOUR. Finding his stride after a solid week at Torrey Pines. 
ROB BOLTON 
I’m reeling. I feel like I’m in four-down territory in the second quarter, but I need to remain patient. Must start getting four to the cut line before I can even think about applying pressure. 
EXPERT 
PROJECTED WINNER 
Hideki Matsuyama 
I’m reeling. I feel like I’m in four-down territory in the second quarter, but I need to remain patient. Must start getting four to the cut line before I can even think about applying pressure. 
JAMES HICKEY 
Jordan Spieth scored a top 10 here in his only visit to WMPO. Banking on his second trip ending with a trip to the winner circle. 
EXPERT 
PROJECTED WINNER 
Jordan Spieth 
Jordan Spieth scored a top 10 here in his only visit to WMPO. Banking on his second trip ending with a trip to the winner circle. 
CDW, an official partner of the PGA TOUR, offers its weekly fantasy selection. Here's this week's "Data-Driven Decision." 
The computer selected greens in regulation, par-5 birdie-or-better percentage and strokes gained: putting as the three most important statistics this week. After calculating this season's ranks in those categories of every player in the field, the computer made the following prediction for this week's winner.
